captions.text:
You got us into this parking lot, pal.
Now you get us out !

You want out of
this parking lot ? Okay.

- Would there be anything else ?
- Yes, do you have the Miss Piggy ?

- There's pants and burgers.
- Yeah, lots of space in this mall.

- Baby clothes.
- This place has got everything.

The new Oldsmobiles
are in early this year.

comments.text:
Here's a fun fact for you guys to know: after that chase was filmed, the 
mall actually sued the production studio for the damages that were caused 
in that chase. If you want to know where I found that out from, I honestly 
don't remember, but I know that I heard it from somewhere. :(﻿
comments.author: 1l0veGod

comments.text:
+mmmfloorpie +Huggy1959 Thanks, guys. I figured that out as I scrolled down

comments.author: 1l0veGod

comments.text:
It was the Dixie Square Mall in Harvey, IL. The fact is that, yes, it was 
shuttered and vacant for almost two years when they did the three days of 
filming for this scene. The mall was, at that point, owned by the Harvey 
School District and THEY sued the production company and settled for an 
undisclosed amount.

Another interesting tidbit: there was no Toys R Us at the mall, the Toys R 
Us scene was shot at Walgreens, which wanted nothing to do with the movie. 
There WAS a Jewel at the mall but they were not acessible from the inside 
of the mall; they wanted to be in the movie, so the Jewel was built in the 
entrance of one of the anchors (Wards, I think). The mall actually was 
pretty small, as far as malls go. I've been there.
comments.author: Huggy1959

comments.text:
There were no damages, it was a vacant mall. 
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dixie_Square_Mall

comments.author: Lockemeister

comments.text:
+CeltHDfifa I know that is why it was the stunt people were on the shopping 
floor they needed people who could pull that off. Not only that but Dan 
Aykroyd drove the car for a lot of the car scenes. He is apparently a major 
car junkie and great stunt/ race/ cross country driver depending on why he 
wants to be behind the wheel.  He has been known to spontaneously jump into 
his car drive from Illinois to California and back for no other reason than 
he just enjoys being behind the wheel of a car. 

Although the scene before this one where they were driving in the parking 
lot was being done by a stunt driver because the director managed to make a 
deal with a car company to allow them to fill up the entire parking lot, 
but the problem was that they were all literally right off manufacturer and 
released that same year. So the entire parking lot was filled with top of 
the line latest models of that year completely unused and they weren't 
allowed to get a single scratch on them. The Director admitted to being 
terrified the entirety of the filming for that scene praying to god that 
the stunt drivers don't accidentally hit one.
comments.author: Timothy Harwood

comments.text:
+Timothy Harwood That is insane. You could tell that it was close to death 
for a lot of those people if they accidentally slipped up.
comments.author: CeltHDfifa

comments.text:
According to the commentary all of the stuntmen for the scene were actually 
the mall shoppers their job was to be able to get out of the way at the 
last minute while they drove around.

comments.author: TexasBlues2000

comments.text:
+TexasBlues2000 The actors name was Gary Mclarty (of course no relation to 
Murray). Sadly he died just over a week ago in a car accident. He was an 
actor and stuntman and had been working since the mid-60s. Unfortunately 
for him, he was in the helicopter when it killed vic morrow on the twilight 
zone set. He also testified against Robert blake for his wifes murder. I 
hope he rests in peace

comments.author: Carlos Ortega Elizalde

comments.text:
+I see that you are taking time out of your day to read my completely 
unnecessarily long username. No.  Educate her.

I actually take the unpopular view that The Blues Brothers isn't actually a 
musical.  In a musical, the music relates to the plot or feelings of the 
characters.  The only songs in The Blues Brothers that do that are Think 
and Jailhouse Rock.  That being said, John Landis' observation is 
completely correct - there is more music in this movie than in many 
musicals.

comments.author: HeySlowPokes

comments.text:
Dear Jacob,
Lots of people were very upset about the Sound Of Music.
Many lives were damaged and rendered useless from the shock of their not 
having better working contracts.
The owners made more than a billion of dollars from this movie.
Poor old Julie Andrews only made $250,000.oo
.
Have you seen every Easter the seven children actors, re-unioining to make 
some of the money that they missed out on because of their original old 
fashioned work contracts, that didn't give them percentage.
.
Many people associated with the movie have been damaged far more than a few 
hundred old cop cars and due-for-demolition-anyway shopping mall.
.
The nazi attack in the Blues Brothers was not as sustained an attack as 
that done, throughout the Sound Of Music, including the poor Rolfe, the 
angry young brown-shirt, he never got over being told by the captain, that 
''you'll never be one of them".
.
Daily Mail:
Daniel Truhitte is mad he was excluded from the 'Sound of Music' reunion, 
*(because?)* even though his character *Rolfe* revealed the von Trapp 
family hiding place to his fellow Nazi soldiers.
.
After the original Blues Brothers movie, not much happened.
.
Thanks for your comment, anyway.
.
Cheers.
from
Rebecca.

Quote reference: 
http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1325080/Actor-Daniel-Truhitte-played-Rolfe-Nazi-angry-left-The-Sound-Music-reunion.html#ixzz33QV8Z4vl
 
Follow us:@MailOnline on Twitter | DailyMail on Facebook

end of message
